sen.j: 光明皇后（こうみょうこうごう、大宝 (日本)元年（701年） - 天平宝字4年6月7日 (旧暦)（760年7月27日））は、奈良時代の人。
sen.e: Empress Komyo (701 - July 27, 760) was a person in the Nara period.
Empress Komyo (701 - July 27, 760) was a person in the Nara period.
Empress Komyo (701 - July 27, 760) was a person in the Nara period.

sen.j: 聖武天皇の皇后。
sen.e: Empress of Emperor Shomu
She was the Empress of Emperor Shomu.
She was the Empress of Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 藤原不比等と県犬養三千代（橘三千代）の娘であり、聖武天皇の母である藤原宮子は異母姉。
sen.e: She was a daughter between FUJIWARA no Fuhito and Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo (ACHIBANA no Michiyo) and FUJIWARA no Miyako, mother of Emperor Shomu, was her paternal half-sister.
She was a daughter between FUJIWARA no Fuhito and Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo (ACHIBANA no Michiyo) and FUJIWARA no Miyako, mother of Emperor Shomu, was her paternal half-sister.
She was a daughter between FUJIWARA no Fuhito and Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo (ACHIBANA no Michiyo) and FUJIWARA no Miyako, mother of Emperor Shomu, was her paternal half-sister.

sen.j: 名は安宿媛（あすかべひめ）。
sen.e: Her name was Asukabehime.
Her name was Asukabehime.
Her name was Asukabehime.

sen.j: 光明子（こうみょうし）、藤三娘（とうさんじょう）ともいう。
sen.e: She was also called Komyoshi or Tosanjo.
She was also called Komyoshi or Tosanjo.
She was also called Komyoshi or Tosanjo.

sen.j: なお、「光明皇后」というのは諡号や追号の類ではなく通称で、正式な尊号は天平応真仁正皇太后という。
sen.e: Empress Komyo' was not a shigo (posthumous title) or a posthumous title, but a common name, and her formal honorary title was 天平応真仁正皇太后 (Tenpyo Oshinninsho Kotaigo).
sen.cmt: 真仁正皇太后は「 真仁正皇太后(Tenpyo Oshinninsho Kotaigo)」としました。
sen.e: Empress Komyo' was not a shigo (posthumous title) or a posthumous title, but a common name, and her formal honorary title was 天平応真仁正皇太后 (Empress Dowager Tenpyo Oshinninsho).
sen.cmt: 尊号の皇太后をEmpress Dowagerとしました。
sen.e: Empress Komyo' was not a shigo (posthumous title) or a posthumous title, but a common name, and her formal honorary title was 天平応真仁正皇太后 (Empress Dowager Tenpyo Oshinninsho).

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 聖武天皇の皇太子時代に結婚し、718年（養老2年）孝謙天皇を出産。
sen.e: She married Emperor Shomu when he was a prince and gave birth to Empress Koken in 718.
She married Emperor Shomu when he was the Crown Prince and gave birth to Empress Koken in 718.
sen.cmt: 皇太子をCrown Princeとしました。
sen.e: She married Emperor Shomu when he was the Crown Prince and gave birth to Empress Koken in 718.

sen.j: 724年（神亀元年）夫の即位とともに後宮の位階である夫人号を得る。
sen.e: When her husband ascended the throne in 724, she received the the title of Bunin/Fujin (consort of the emperor) as Ikai (Court rank) of kokyu (empress's residence).
When her husband ascended the throne in 724, she received the the title of Bunin/Fujin (consort of the emperor) as Ikai (Court rank) of kokyu (empress's residence).
When her husband ascended the throne in 724, she received the the title of Fujin (consort of the emperor) as Ikai (Court rank) of kokyu (empress's residence).

sen.j: 727年（神亀4年）基王（もといおう）を生んだ。
sen.e: She gave birth to Motoio in 727.
She gave birth to Motoio in 727.
She gave birth to Motoio in 727.

sen.j: 728年（神亀5年）皇太子に立てられた基王が夭折したため後継を争って長屋王が起こるなど紛糾した。
sen.e: Since Motoio who was selected as a prince died young in 728, a race for successor began and Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) occurred.
Since Motoio who had been selected as Crown Prince died young in 728, a race for successor began and the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) occurred.
sen.cmt: 文法修正と単語修正をしました。
sen.e: Since Motoio who had been selected as Crown Prince died young in 728, a race for successor began and the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) occurred.

sen.j: 長屋王の変後、729年（天平元年）皇后にするとの詔が発せられた。
sen.e: An imperial edict that she became empress was issued in 729 after the Nagayao no Hen.
An imperial edict that she became empress was issued in 729 after the Nagayao no Hen.
An imperial edict that she became empress was issued in 729 after the Nagayao no Hen.

sen.j: これは王族以外から立后された初例である。
sen.e: This was the first time that a person other than the royal family became empress.
This was the first time that a person other than the royal family became empress.
This was the first time that a person other than the royal family became empress.

sen.j: 以後、藤原氏の子女が皇后になる先例となった。
sen.e: This was a precedent that children of the Fujiwara clan became empress.
This set a precedent that children of the Fujiwara clan became empress.
sen.cmt: 言い回しを修正しました。
sen.e: This set a precedent that children of the Fujiwara clan became empress.

sen.j: 娘である阿倍内親王の立太子、およびその後の孝謙天皇としての即位（749年（天平勝宝元年））後、皇后宮職を紫微中台（しびちゅうだい）と改称し、甥の藤原仲麻呂を長官に任じてさまざまな施策を行った。
sen.e: After the investiture of the Crown Prince to a daughter the Imperial princess Abe and enthronement of Empress Koken (749), Kogogushiki (the Queen-consort's Household Agency) was renamed to Shibi chudai (the office handled the principal empress Komyo's affairs) and a nephew FUJIWARA no Nakamaro was assigned to its chief to take various measures.

After the investiture of the Crown Princess to her daughter the Imperial princess Abe and her enthronement as Empress Koken (749), Kogogushiki (the Queen-consort's Household Agency) was renamed to Shibi chudai (the office handled the principal empress Komyo's affairs) and her nephew FUJIWARA no Nakamaro was assigned to its chief to implement various measures.
sen.cmt: 女性名詞への変更と単語修正をしました。
sen.e: After the investiture of the Crown Princess to her daughter the Imperial princess Abe and her enthronement as Empress Koken (749), Kogogushiki (the Queen-consort's Household Agency) was renamed to Shibi chudai (the office handled the principal empress Komyo's affairs) and her nephew FUJIWARA no Nakamaro was assigned to its chief to implement various measures.

sen.j: 756年（天平勝宝8歳）夫の聖武太上天皇が亡くなる。
sen.e: Her husband Shomu Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor) died in 756.
Her husband Shomu Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor) died in 756.
Her husband Shomu Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor) died in 756.

sen.j: その2年後には皇太后号が贈られた。
sen.e: She was given the title of Empress Dowager two years later.
She was given the title of Empress Dowager two years later.
She was given the title of Empress Dowager two years later.

sen.j: 760年（天平宝字4年）逝去、佐保山東陵に葬られた。
sen.e: She died and was buried in Sahoyama no higashi no misasagi (the eastern Imperial tomb in Saho-yama mountain) in 760.
She died and was buried in Sahoyama no higashi no misasagi (the eastern Imperial tomb in Saho-yama mountain) in 760.
She died and was buried in Sahoyama no higashi no misasagi (the eastern Imperial tomb in Saho-yama mountain) in 760.

sen.j: 文化的側面
sen.e: Cultural aspects
Cultural aspects
Cultural aspects

sen.j: 光明皇后は仏教に篤く帰依し、東大寺、国分寺の設立を夫に進言したと伝えられる。
sen.e: Empress Komyo embraced the Buddhist faith and advised her husband to build Todai-ji Temple and Kokubun-ji Temple.
Empress Komyo embraced the Buddhist faith and advised her husband to build Todai-ji Temple and Kokubun-ji Temple.
Empress Komyo embraced the Buddhist faith and advised her husband to build Todai-ji Temple and Kokubun-ji Temple.

sen.j: また貧しい人に施しをするための施設「悲田院」、医療施設である「施薬院」を設置して慈善を行った。
sen.e: She practiced charity by establishing 'Hidenin Temple' for giving alms to the poor and a medical facility 'Seyaku-in'.
She practiced charity by establishing 'Hidenin Temple' for giving alms to the poor and a medical facility 'Seyaku-in'.
She practiced charity by establishing 'Hidenin Temple' for giving alms to the poor and a medical facility 'Seyaku-in'.

sen.j: 夫の死後四十九日に遺品などを東大寺に寄進、その宝物を収めるために正倉院が創設された。
sen.e: She donated articles of her deceased husband to Todai-ji Temple 49 days after the death of her husband and Shosoin Treasure House was built to store them.
She donated articles of her deceased husband to Todai-ji Temple 49 days after the death of her husband and Shosoin Treasure House was built to store them.
She donated articles of her deceased husband to Todai-ji Temple 49 days after the death of her husband and Shosoin Treasure House was built to store them.

sen.j: さらに、興福寺、法華寺、新薬師寺など多くの寺院の創建や整備に関わった。
sen.e: In addition, she founded and renovated many temples, such as Kofuku-ji Temple, Hokke-ji Temple and Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple.
In addition, she founded and renovated many temples, such as Kofuku-ji Temple, Hokke-ji Temple and Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple.
In addition, she founded and renovated many temples, such as Kofuku-ji Temple, Hokke-ji Temple and Shin-Yakushi-ji Temple.

sen.j: また、書道をよくし、奈良時代の書家として聖武天皇とともに有名であり、作品には『楽毅論』（がっきろん）や『杜家立成雑書要略』（とけりっせいざっしょようりゃく）などがある。
sen.e: She was skilled in calligraphy, she and Emperor Shomu were famous calligraphers in the Nara period, and she created "Gakki-ron essay" and "Toka rissei zassho yoryaku".
sen.cmt: 杜家立成雑書要略はToka rissei zassho yoryakuとしました。
sen.e: She was skilled in calligraphy, she and Emperor Shomu are famous as calligraphers of Nara period, and she created "Gakki-ron essay" and "Toka rissei zassho yoryaku".
She was skilled in calligraphy, she and Emperor Shomu are famous as calligraphers of Nara period, and she created "Gakki-ron essay" and "Toka rissei zassho yoryaku".

sen.j: 楽毅論
sen.e: Gakki-ron essay
Gakki-ron essay
Gakki-ron essay

sen.j: 王羲之の『王羲之楷書』を臨書した名品であり、本文は縦簾目のある白麻紙二帳半に43行、奥の軸付に黄麻紙一帳を添えて「天平十六年十月三日藤三娘」と署名がある。
sen.e: This essay was a masterpiece created by copying "Wang Xizhi Text" written by Xizhi WANG, 43 lines of text were written on two and half sheets of white machi with vertical streaks, and a sheet of Omashi was attached to the rear shaft, with a signature of 'October 3, Tenpyo 16, Tosanjo'.
sen.cmt: 天平十六年十月三日藤三娘はOctober 3, Tenpyo 16, Tosanjoとしました。
sen.e: This essay was a masterpiece created by copying "Wang Xizhi Text" written by Xizhi WANG, 43 lines of text were written on two and half sheets of white mashi (paper made of hemp) with vertical streaks, and a sheet of yellow mashi was attached to the rear shaft, with a signature of 'October 3, Tenpyo 16, Tosanjo'.
sen.cmt: 麻紙の訳を訂正しました。黄麻紙もOmashiで登録されていますが、yellow mashiとした方が意味が通じると思います。
sen.e: This essay was a masterpiece created by copying "Wang Xizhi Text" written by Xizhi WANG, 43 lines of text were written on two and half sheets of white mashi (paper made of hemp) with vertical streaks, and a sheet of yellow mashi was attached to the rear shaft, with a signature of 'October 3, Tenpyo 16, Tosanjo'.

sen.j: 筆力は雄健である。
sen.e: The brush strokes are powerful.
The brush strokes are powerful.
The brush strokes are powerful.

sen.j: 和歌は「万葉集」に4首とられている。
sen.e: Four waka poems are collected in 'Manyoshu' (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).
Four waka poems are collected in 'Manyoshu' (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).
Four waka poems are collected in 'Manyoshu' (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves).

sen.j: 仏教の庇護者としてさまざな伝説も伝えられており、光明皇后が、重症の癩病（らいびょう。ハンセン病）患者の膿をみずから吸ったところ、その病人が阿閦如来（あしゅくにょらい）であったという話はよく知られている。
sen.e: There are many legends about her as a Buddhism patron and it is a well-known episode that when Empress Komyo sucked the pus of a severely ill leper, the patient was Ashuku Nyorai.
There are many legends about her as a Buddhism patron and it is a well-known episode that when Empress Komyo sucked the pus of a severely ill leper, the patient was Ashuku Nyorai.
There are many legends about her as a Buddhism patron and it is a well-known episode that when Empress Komyo sucked the pus of a severely ill leper, the patient was Ashuku Nyorai.

sen.j: 都大路に並木を造る際に、貧しい人が飢えないようモモとナシの木を選んで植させたと伝えられる。
sen.e: It is said that when boulevard trees were planted along the main thoroughfare of the metropolis, peach and nashi (Japanese pear) trees were planted so that the poor did not starve.
It is said that when boulevard trees were planted along the main thoroughfare of the metropolis, peach and nashi (Japanese pear) trees were planted so that the poor would not starve.
It is said that when boulevard trees were planted along the main thoroughfare of the metropolis, peach and nashi (Japanese pear) trees were planted so that the poor would not starve.

sen.j: 大阪府和泉市と堺市南区 (堺市)に跨る位置にある光明池の名前は、光明皇后生誕の地という伝説から由来している。
sen.e: The name of the Komyo-ike pond located at the boundary of Izumi City, Osaka Prefecture and Sakai City, Minami Ward (Sakai City) is derived from a legend that it was the birth place of Empress Komyo.
The name of the Komyo-ike pond located at the boundary of Izumi City and Minami Ward (Sakai City), Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture is derived from a legend that it was the birth place of Empress Komyo.
sen.cmt: 地名の語順を修正しました。
sen.e: The name of the Komyo-ike pond located at the boundary of Izumi City and Minami Ward (Sakai City), Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture is derived from a legend that it was the birth place of Empress Komyo.

sen.j: なお、現在は泉北高速鉄道の駅名（光明池駅）や学校、運転免許試験場などの公的機関の名前などにも使用されている。
sen.e: At present, her name is used as the name (Komyo-ike) of a station of the Senboku Kosokutetsudo and the names of public organizations, such as schools and the Department of Motor Vehicles.
At present, her name is used as the name of a station (Komyo-ike) of the Semboku Rapid Railway and the names of public organizations, such as schools and the Driver's License Center.
sen.cmt: 語順を修正しました。泉北高速鉄道を英語名に変更し、運転免許試験場の訳を登録名に揃えました。
sen.e: At present, her name is used as the name of a station (Komyo-ike) of the Semboku Rapid Railway and the names of public organizations, such as schools and the Driver's License Center.

sen.j: 大阪府岸和田市にある久米田寺周辺は「久米田古墳群」に指定されており、その中に「光明（光明皇后）塚古墳」がある。
sen.e: The area around Kumeda-dera Temple in Kishiwada City, Osaka Prefecture, was specified as 'Kumeda burial mounds', which includes 'Komyo (Empress Komyo) tumulus'.
The area around Kumeda-dera Temple in Kishiwada City, Osaka Prefecture, is specified as 'Kumeda burial mounds', which includes 'Komyo (Empress Komyo) tumulus'.
The area around Kumeda-dera Temple in Kishiwada City, Osaka Prefecture, is specified as 'Kumeda burial mounds', which includes 'Komyo (Empress Komyo) tumulus'.
